original_solution_mapping.L2: After his mom took 5 chocolates, Alix has now 30 - 5 = <<30-5=25>>25 chocolate.
original_solution_mapping.L3: So Alix has 25 - 10 = <<25-10=15>>15 chocolates more than Nick.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5342.
    Returns: how many more chocolates Alix has than Nick.
    """
    # L1
    nick_chocolates = 10 # Nick hides 10 chocolates
    alix_multiplier = 3 # 3 times as many chocolates than Nick hides
    alix_initial_chocolates = alix_multiplier * nick_chocolates

    # L2
    mom_took_chocolates = 5 # took 5 chocolates from Alix
    alix_remaining_chocolates = alix_initial_chocolates - mom_took_chocolates

    # L3
    alix_more_than_nick = alix_remaining_chocolates - nick_chocolates

    # FA
    answer = alix_more_than_nick
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: After his mom took {mom_took_chocolates} chocolates, Alix has now {alix_initial_chocolates} - {mom_took_chocolates} = <<{alix_initial_chocolates}-{mom_took_chocolates}={alix_remaining_chocolates}>>{alix_remaining_chocolates} chocolate.
So Alix has {alix_remaining_chocolates} - {nick_chocolates} = <<{alix_remaining_chocolates}-{nick_chocolates}={alix_more_than_nick}>>{alix_more_than_nick} chocolates more than Nick.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: After his mom took 5 chocolates, Alix has now 30 - 5 = <<30-5=25>>25 chocolate.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So Alix has 25 - 5 = <<25-5=20>>20 chocolates more than Nick.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'mom_took_chocolates' (5) was used instead of 'nick_chocolates' (10).
